name: Rubber Plant
climate: Prefers tropical climates with high humidity and warm temperatures.
Thrives in temperate climates where winters are mild and summers are warm.
Struggles in cold climates that experience frost and dry air conditions.
Ideal for subtropical climates that provide consistent warmth and moist air.
sunlight: Enjoys bright, indirect light but can tolerate some direct sun.
Best growth in environments with partial shade during peak sun hours.
Can adapt to low light but may hinder growth in dim conditions.
Avoids locations with full harsh sunlight as it can scorch the leaves.
watering: Needs watering every 1-2 weeks, allowing soil to dry out between waterings.
In spring and summer, keep the soil consistently moist but not soggy.
Reduce watering frequency in fall and winter, allowing more drying time.
Signs of overwatering include yellow leaves and root rot symptoms.
soil: Requires well-draining soil mix, preferably peat-based or cactus soil.
The soil should retain moisture without becoming waterlogged or compacted.
A mix with perlite or sand can improve drainage and aeration for roots.
Avoid using heavy clay soils that retain water and restrict root growth.
toxic: The plant is considered toxic to pets like cats and dogs if ingested.
Symptoms of ingestion in pets include vomiting, drooling, and oral irritation.
Contain calcium oxalate crystals which can cause discomfort when chewed.
Advised to keep out of reach of pets and young children to prevent issues.
extra_care_tip: Regularly wipe leaves with a damp cloth to keep them dust-free and shiny.
Rotate the plant periodically to ensure even growth and exposure to light.
Prune any damaged or yellowing leaves to maintain plant health and appearance.
Repot every couple of years to refresh soil and provide more space for growth.
